IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Orphan's Hands exists to save vulnerable orphans and at-risk youth from human trafficking through housing, education, and care, to encourage and equip orphans to become missionaries to their nations, and to spread the love of Jesus and the Gospel both abroad and at home.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Orphan's Hands provides safe homes and education for orphaned youth at risk of being trafficked in high-risk countries while bringing the love and hope of Jesus Christ.
IRS990.Desc: Moldova & Ukraine- We offer housing to orphaned young men and women, and provide basic daily physical needs, education, and care. The young men and women in our program voluntarily engage in weekly missions outreach to homeless, orphans, and vulnerable families and communities by providing basic needs, such as food, clothing, firewood as well as sharing the love of God.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The Evangelism Ministry travels throughout the United States proclaiming the gospel of Jesus Christ. Radio, television, music and web links are also used.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Support local ministries through monetary contribution

OtherExpensesGrp.Desc: Foreign and Domestic Missions & Love Offerings

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Orphans Hands provided the Ukraine war refugees shelter, meals, blankets, and much-needed supplies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Philip D Cameron is president, and his three children are directors but not officers of The Orphans Hands Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members are nominated and elected annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The President's compensation package is subject to majority approval by the independent board members.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Once the financial director receives the completed draft, he or she reviews and approves its accuracy, then the draft is submitted directly to the board for approval to file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members communicate regularly. If an upcoming event may present a conflict of interest, someone will meet with the board member or members to assess the situation. If the matter cannot be resolved during this meeting, the board will schedule a special session to discuss the situation. Regardless of how the case is settled, every board member will receive a copy of the notes on the meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The accountant and financial managers collected a number of comparable compensation packages from other non-profit organizations that share similar functions, sizes, regions, and revenue as our organization. This was done to create a foundation for our organization's own compensation package, which is presented to the board in alternate years.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: After receiving a written request, The Orphans Hands Inc. will send a copy of the relevant documentation via mail.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: After receiving a written request, The Orphans Hands Inc. will send a copy of the relevant documentation via mail.
